intro: Eriocephalus pectinifolius, commonly known as the yellow oxalis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Oxalidaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers with five petals. The plant has heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Eriocephalus pectinifolius is also known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
